Job Posting:174584 - Position: W26 Business Analytics Co-op Student 174584B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 10/26/2025 11:59 PM Through UBC Science Co-op 10/20/2025 03:12 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country OLG 4120 Yonge Street, Suite 600 Toronto M2P 2B8 Ontario Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description Job Req: R25_00449 2026 - Winter W26 Business Analytics Co-op Student 174584B Co-op Position Toronto, ON or Sault Ste. Marie, ON Canada 4 months In-Person CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $18.50 - $28.50 hourly Duration: Winter (January-April 2026) GAME ON - OLG needs you We've said GAME ON, and we mean it - OLG is rapidly transforming its organization to better serve Ontarians by delivering great gaming experiences through our digital, retail lottery, and land-based gaming channels. Over the course of fiscal 2023-24, OLG delivered a record $2.4 billion in net profit to the Province of Ontario. OLG is now expanding our horizons even further, with a new strategic direction that builds on successes to date as a world class gaming entertainment leader with a globally admired omni- channel platform. We are ready to take this game to the next level and need a passionate Business Analytics, Co-op Student to be responsible for supporting and contributing towards the OLG's operational, financial, digital, and strategic initiatives through the compilation, analysis, and interpretation of information to all senior decision makers. YOUR ROLE IN THE GAME: • Responsible for supporting analytical initiatives, projects, and deliverables from lines of OLG business. • Develop analytical models, reports and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI • Collect data from various sources and proactively monitor customer and operational performance across the Enterprise and report on areas of opportunity. • Provide objective analytical expertise in the development of high-profile business cases and/or ad hoc projects. • Monitor all published operational data and take action/ownership to ensure accuracy, consistency, relevance, and timeliness of the information. Contribute to improving the quality of information by auditing existing data collection/input processes. • Responsible for the creation of support documentation for analysis findings, presentations, reports, training sessions, templates, etc. • Works with key stakeholders to understand relevant business opportunities and propose analytics-based solutions to the business challenges, often working & collaborating closely with other teams across the organization. Communicate with key stakeholders at all levels to translate complex technical concepts into actionable insights. • PERKS OF JOINING OUR TEAM: • Working as part of a large Technology and Digitally driven organization • Being part of a collaborative working environment alongside OLG Leaders who support the growth and development of students • Participate in Diversity and Inclusion initiatives across the organization including Pride Parade and Women's Leadership Programs • Support OLG Charities including the Federated Health Campaign, United Way Campaign and other fundraising efforts for local charities Learn about OLG - GAME ON! OLG's purpose is to contribute to a better Ontario by delivering great entertainment experiences for our customers. We are a multi- billion-dollar organization with a wide array of business lines including, lottery, land-based casinos, digital lottery and casino, horseracing, and charitable gaming. OLG is amidst a massive transformation focusing on being customer obsessed and bringing our digital business to a whole new level. The key to our success is our people. Our culture will be grounded in true, positive partnerships that embrace trust, clarity, and openness in all that we do. We are supporting and empowering employees and teams across the organization through greater accountability, leadership development and growth opportunities. Equity, diversity, and inclusion are essential elements of our culture and cornerstones of the Five Truths that OLGers Live by. At OLG, our employees have the space to be themselves and use their perspectives and skills to benefit the people and the Province of Ontario. While we are re-shaping and growing our business, we are unwavering when it comes to living our purpose, and ensuring our business delivers meaningful benefits for the people of Ontario. OLG's net profits are reinvested back into the province, contributing to the quality of life for Ontarians. To learn more about OLG go to our website at www.olg.ca Application Deadline: October 26, 2025. OLG is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please contact Human Resources at careers@olg.ca if you require accommodation at any time throughout the hire process We thank you for your interest in this opportunity; however only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted. #LI-ONSITE Personal information is collected by the Ontario Lottery & Gaming Corporation (OLG) and/or its third party service provider(s) under the authority of the Ontario Lottery and Gaming Corporation Act, 1999, SO 1999, c 12, Sch L and the Employment Standards Act, 2000, S.O. 2000, c. 41 (as amended) and will be used for the purpose of determining qualifications for employment with OLG and for recruitment modernization initiatives. The information will be managed in accordance with all applicable laws, OLG's Protection of Privacy Policy (the Policy) and related policies and procedures. For any questions about this collection, please contact careers@olg.ca, 800-70 Foster Drive, Sault Ste. Marie, ON, P6A 6V2. Job Requirements WHAT YOU NEED TO PLAY: • Working toward a university degree or College diploma in business/commerce, statistics, computer science, economics, finance, or mathematics. • Knowledge of key languages and platforms such as: Microsoft Power BI, Python, SQL, Hadoop, Alteryx, Excel. • Solid understanding of database concepts and data modelling. • Application development or programming with Python and other back-end platforms. • Experience collecting, wrangling, cleansing, organizing, and automating disparate data sources to power analytical outputs. • Analytical skills: ability to apply statistical methods and quantitative analysis techniques to identify patterns, trends, and insights. • Data translation capabilities: ability to explain analytical and statistical modeling to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. • Attention to details: responsible for producing reports and analysis that are accurate and reliable. • Results driven with excellent problem-solving skills to identify problems and develop innovative solutions to resolve them. • Business acumen: Have a good understanding of the industry and OLG's business. An effective self-starter with excellent time- management and interpersonal skills who thrives in an environment that demands teamwork. N/A Citizenship Requirement APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through UBC Science Co-op Special Application Instructions Application Deadline: October 26, 2025 Application Instructions: - If you are in a co-op program, please apply through your school's portal or co-op coordinator AND through the OLG student careers page: https://olg.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers-Students - If you are not in an official co-op program or we have not posted at your school, please apply through the OLG student careers page using the link above. Application Link: https://olg.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers-Students Please submit your application on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
